# Example Post with Quarto

This post demonstrates advanced features available with Quarto.

## Code with Syntax Highlighting

```python
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Generate data
x = np.linspace(0, 2*np.pi, 100)
y = np.sin(x)

# Plot
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(x, y, 'b-', linewidth=2)
plt.title('Sine Wave')
plt.xlabel('x')
plt.ylabel('sin(x)')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()
```

## Mathematical Equations

You can include LaTeX equations:

$$E = mc^2$$

And inline math like $\alpha + \beta = \gamma$.

## Tables

| Feature | Markdown | Quarto |
|---------|----------|--------|
| Basic formatting | ✓ | ✓ |
| Code highlighting | ✓ | ✓ |
| Math equations | Limited | ✓ |
| Interactive plots | ✗ | ✓ |
